protein.specific_function: Probable large-conductance Ca(2+)-activated chloride channel. May play a role in Ca(2+) signal transduction. May be involved in cell proliferation and cell aggregation

reference.reference_text: Rae FK, Hooper JD, Eyre HJ, Sutherland GR, Nicol DL, Clements JA: TTYH2, a human homologue of the Drosophila melanogaster gene tweety, is located on 17q24 and upregulated in renal cell carcinoma. Genomics. 2001 Oct;77(3):200-7.
